title: Documentation on how to get Apache Solr running on Windows?
description:
Looking for documentation how to get Apache Solr running on Windows.

I'm looking to run my .NET website on a Windows machine combined with Apache Solr (this may be solrsharp or the regular Apache Solr).

And can anyone advise me on what hosting configuration is needed? My wish is to stay as close to an MS configuration as possible.

So I definately need:
IIS
.NET framework

But do I need:
Tomcat?
Apache webserver?
JDK?
Anything else?

comments.author: Erik Hatcher
comments.content:
Please ask user questions on the solr-user list.

Briefly, though, you'll need Tomcat or Jetty or some Java web container to run Solr.   solrsharp is purely a Solr client, not a .NET version of Solr.  Solr is purely Java.
